result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:43 AM Defendant Cody Allen Froh appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Casey James Hoff in court for Cody Allen Froh.  Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant enters not guilty plea on all counts. 
Case to go to branch 5 after arraignment. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Branch 5 to address bond motion.

1:03 PM Defendant Cody Allen Froh in court in custody.  Attorney Casey James Hoff in court for Cody Allen Froh.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Hoff rcvd' prelim offer from State, Deft waives pre-lim. Pre-lim questionnaire and waiver filed, probable cause found, Deft bound over. Court, under local Court rules this will be sent to br. 5 after arraignment. State filed info, same charges. Defense requests more time for arraignment to talk with Deft. Court would like bail motion referred to br. 5.
Arraignment scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property. 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Remain within the State of Wisconsin. 
Comply with day reporting requirements; GPS monitoring.
